title: (x) Rounding / Bluring Typeface edges
content:
Hey,

I don't know how to explain it very well but I found an example..  
Maybe it is a function in Illustrator... Allowing you to give a very subtle rounded edge to fonts.

The example uses Helvetica, but we can notice a soft / rounded edge ... especially on the "15"

Any info is welcome! :)

Thanks!

comments.content:
oh cool...!

but I've seen many well known faces altered this way, for titling pruposes for example...  
i doubt they use quick made free faces... there must be a way to transform the actual typeface

??

In Illustrator you can use the scripts [Round Any Corner](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202005850/http:/www.adobe.com/cfusion/exchange/index.cfm?event=extensionDetail&extid=1045709), but first you have to convert the text into outlines.

Or use plugins.
Is there a way to do this direclty in Fontlab?

Wasn't there a Python script that does this?

hhp

That "round any corner" script works quite well... Very simple.

Thanks
